40967123.review:
Campaña:
Es una campaña simple,no dura mas de 8 horas,tiene algunas misiones cortas o aburridas,la musica es casi nula y no hay personajes memobrables PERO tiene una buena variedad de armas algunas otras misiones son bastantes buenas por ejemplo Battleship Tirpitz.Considero la campaña Britanica como la mejor ya que son bastantes buenas las misiones y la Sovietica como la mas dificil.En resumen la campaña esta bastante bien aunque no es la gran cosa.
7/10

Multijugador:
Es todavia mas basico que la campaña y esta completamente abandonado y de todas formas no es la gran cosa,ya que no hay que te motive a jugarlo.Los mapas son casi iguales a los de la campaña y estan todas las armas.No vale la pena jugarlo mas que para probarlo o jugar con un amigo por puro gusto.
5/10

Otros apartados
-Este juego no tiene ningun modo extra.
-No hay VAC.
-No hay nube ni para campaña ni para multijugador.
-SE PUEDEN instalar mods.

Nota final:6.5/10 
A pesar de todo lo recomiendo a los fans de Call of Duty para ver el origen de la saga.

40933215.review:
O jogo foi lançado há 15 anos... Joguei pela primeira vez em 2018. Diverti-me bastante. Invejo aqueles que, na época certa, perderam incontáveis horas nos servidores multiplayer. Uma pena que a franquia se desviou bastante dessa raíz nos títulos subsequentes.

Gráficos: 08/10
Ragdolls muito bem feitos, gráficos excelentes para um jogo de 2013.

Som: 10/10
O ponto principal desse jogo. Explosões, tiros e trilha sonora de qualidade fazem com que o jogador se sinta, de fato, em uma zona de coflito. Excepcional.

Jogabilidade: 08/10
O básico dos FPS mais antigos. Mecânicas de movimentação simples, porém bastante funcionais. Como dizem por aí, estilo raíz.

Enredo: 07/10
O tema WWII dispensa notas. Foi uma guerra que mudou nosso mundo. Poderia ser mais polido em sua abordagem no jogo, mas convenhamos, a disposição das campanhas e sua inteligação final foram muito bem feitas. 

Modo campanha é o atrativo atual. Não possui multiplayer ativo, o que é compreensível.

Baseado nas minhas especificações (i7, GTX 1080, 32GB RAM), trata-se de um jogo bem leve e que roda sem grandes problemas de compatibilidade em sistemas modernos.

40893371.review: So far so good! I can see why Call of Duty became so popular in its time, the feeling of teamwork is great and everything that goes with it. When you see a tank you immediately look for a good amount of cover and proceed to flank it around buildings as it explodes the walls while you get to a anti-tank weapon. Running through an open field as mortars bombard all around you killing your friends and allies enemy soldiers attempt to pick you off on a mounted gun or behind cover. Very good game even in 2018 4/5 a few negatives are there isn't a sprint option however it isn't really necessary for the type of environments you're in as you won't be advancing as quickly as in the more modern call of duty's, the mounted gunners can have pin point accuracy even if you move position while they cannot see you, grenades can bounce around ridiculously as if they're strapped with bouncy balls and the floor is ice, tanks can sometimes be in really awkward positions to flank around them and every now and then your comrades enjoy walking into walls. But asides from a few nit picks this is a great shooter to experience.

40319590.review:
Call of Duty, the very first in the juggernaut FPS series it spawned, almost seems like a whole different game compared to its later descendants. Instead of contrived technothrillers and invincible patriots sprinting around with sci-fi technology, it gives us vulnerable soldiers taking part in the great and perilous historical undertaking of kicking Hitler's teeth in, and through the intensity of the fighting you participate in it shows that war is Hell in the process. It's a good experience as a result: like a war movie, but a humanizing one, not a jingoistic popcorn flick like later games in the series.

The old-school roots of its id Tech 3 engine are definitely visible - no wonder I thought some of the interface looked similar to Return to Castle Wolfenstein's. However, the gameplay is generally grounded in realism, with cover, leaning and suppressing fire being important for survival. That's not to mention you usually move through levels with squads of friendly soldiers, which at the very least means a little less enemy fire directed at you. Enemy soldiers have a smart and annoying propensity for hiding behind cover. The regenerating health seen in later CoD games is absent here, with a traditional HP system and health kits to heal with instead. This alone gives the game a good amount of challenge, and on higher difficulties can prove kind of frustrating, or at least that was my experience with Hardened difficulty.


See, there's a conflict between the ease with which you die on harder difficulties hammering home how brutal war is, and the fact that [i]not[/i] dying is required to continue with the game. This is, again, mainly because you have a traditional HP system, yet enemies you face almost always have hitscan weaponry that instantly damages you if they don't miss. It doesn't help that sometimes enemies will be in alert mode at times when they shouldn't or too soon, which means they zero in on your position and shoot the instant you so much as lean out of cover.

The characters you play are meant to give a grunt's POV of a brutal war where many, many soldiers die, but you yourself are expected to survive through it all. While I'm sure there were some soldiers lucky enough to survive like that in real life, given the combination of HP/hitscan damage mechanics you'll likely die a number of times during the game's harder moments, or at least the bits without many checkpoints. Reloading a save twelve or so times on a single segment slightly hurts the otherwise well-executed cinematic feel the game was going for, and makes it feel more...well, more game-y, despite how realistic it may be to die quickly, and despite the genuine tension harrowing in-game moments can generate.

Being unable to run and gun and having to play more carefully certainly augments the harrowing feel. The result though is that Call of Duty demands patience perhaps more than any other game in the series, which I suppose isn't a bad thing if you're patient. There were nevertheless times I found myself feeling more like I was playing a somewhat janky old-school game (to be fair Call of Duty [i]is[/i] old-school), and playing it as such, than experiencing a classic war movie in game form as the developers' intention no doubt was.


Still, while there is somewhat of a mismatch between enemies' hitscan damage and the traditional HP system, it ultimately doesn't cripple the game. It's still a gripping and groundbreaking experience. If you approach Call of Duty as a partly old-school product - and let's be honest, either on a lower difficulty or with smart usage of quicksaving - it's a great game for shooter fans and WWII buffs alike.

Multiplayer is surprisingly still a bit active. There's not many players considering the game's age but there are a number of servers, some with bots. The mechanical base is pretty solid; the essentials of what made it popular are there without any egregious stuff like killstreaks. It could be described as 'simcade', overall. Be prepared for some lag given the populated servers will probably be distant from you. If you're going to play multiplayer at all, though, you're probably better off with the [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/trar/recommended/2640/]United Offensive[/url] expansion, which adds more features and has a few more players.

40144945.review: Call of Duty aims to be a fairly basic, quasi-realistic World War 2 FPS about how World War 2 was a really horrible, messy, chaotic place to be, full of squishy humans who were a lot better at killing each other than staying alive, and it pulls that off pretty well. The crouch controls are kinda shitty, the AI's pretty dumb, there are some weird difficulty spikes—especially in the Russian campaign—and it kinda undermines its point about how no one soldier was special by having you play as a series of very special soldiers, but overall it's a pretty solid experience. I recommend it.

40056433.review:
,, Первый Зов Долга ‘’ . 

Прошло 15 лет с момента выхода первого Кода ( на мой взгляд - одна из лучших частей ) , которая подарила нам капитана Прайса , целую серию скриптовых и до жути линейных шутеров разного качества . Именно с неё я влились в серию  и радовался каждой части ( вплоть до Ghost ) .   Смотрится ли она сейчас ?  Скорее да , чем нет , но с парой оговорок , которые я опишу под конец . 

А пока немного истории : В начале 2000-ых , ноунеймы из студии 2015 ( под крылом ,,доброй и справедливой’’ ЕА ) выпустили Medal of Honor : Allied Assault ( 3 игра в серии шутеров о Второй Мировой ) . И она была довольно неплохой , а часть уровней просто поражала ( высадка на Омаха-бич , проникновение на базу немцев с продельными документами , поездка на Королевском Тигре ) , но была в ней одна ,,проблема ‘’ - всю войну мы тащили на своей спине . Напарники были , да помирали довольно быстро , оставляя нас наедине с толпами фрицев . 
Код же был разработан бывшими сотрудниками этой студии ( ЕА и тогда не особо дружили с разработчиками ) и решил проблему Медали - теперь с нами бегает небольшой отряд товарищей , которые иногда неплохо помогают и создают ощущение , что ты всего лишь шестеренка в ужасной войне ( в некоторых миссиях этому способствует также мелькающие на заднем плане бойцы других отрядов , различные скрпитовые бомбежки ) . 

Сюжета в этом Коде нет . Есть лишь 3 компании за Союзников , Англию и СССР ( самая лучшая - за наших . Хоть и не обошлось без клюквы ) , в которых мы просто воюем / выполняем задачи . И это хорошо - в последнем на данном момент Коде , попытка построить единую историю и показать ужасы войны ... Мягко говоря - не вышло . 

Геймплейно , это неплохой  скриптовый шутер на 4-6 часов , который всеми силами старается развеселить : тут и пострелять из пулеметов дают , и на танках покататься . Один разок можно пройти и получить свою долю удовольствия :) . 

Отдельно отмечу адонн United Offensive - авторы просто взяли оригинал и вкололи стероидов . Гораздо больше крутых миссий и моментов ( особенно в компании за Англичан . Впрочем , в компании за СССР тоже хватает крутых сценок ) . 

Касательно минусов : 
0) Графику не буду ругать ( в год выхода она была вполне неплоха ) , но вот сложность поругаю . Как и в любом Коде , повышение уровня сложности влияет лишь на то , сколько ваша тушка выдержит пуль ( ну и на последней у вас отберут аптечки . Следовательно - права на ошибку не будет ) . 
1) Как и во всех таких шутерах - война без вас не закончится . Пока вы не пройдёте вперёд до нужного скрипта - будет бесконечная перестрелка . 
2) 899 рублей . Серьёзно ? Ладно бы 300 ( с адонном . Я Золотое Издание на диске в 2014 за столько брал ) , но нет же 
  Я не люблю придираться к ценам на игры , но это малость перебор . 

Итог : вполне неплохой скриптовый шутер . Для ознакомления на распродаже - вполне можно взять . 

P.S. 8 Прайсов из 10 .

Это игра детсва, да имено этот CoD, а не обоссаный MW. Но мне придется признать, что поверку временем она не прошла. Покупая её думал ну все сейчас сяду зарублюсь в стрый добрый первый CoD. и понимаю, что скучно как то играть, вот честно скучно, мои детские впечатления об этой игре были другие. И тут я понял, что вся серия CoD была конвеером с 2003 года и менялось в ней только обертка. Но есть и положительные моменты если же часть игыры на западном фронте уныла, то начиная с миссии по спасению Прайса Старшего игра набирает обороты миссия на платине очень атмосферна и напоминает RtTCWolfenstein, миссия на крейсере, а миссии в Сталинграде( не смотря на всю клюкву и гыбню по типу загранотрядов и одной винтовки на троих) вообще лучшии, что были за всю серию CoD.
Честно, сейчас её рекомендовать её смысла нет, да и тем более жиды из Activision очень цену заломили  игре , которой 14 лет. Но отзыв положительный из за детских впечатлений 7/10

39777038.review:
Так начинался популярный игро-сериал Call of Duty. Это был первый её шаг в 2003 году. Но всё ли так "олдскульно", как казалось нам раньше?

Да, тогда еще были аптечки, но нет никакого эффекта с них. Они валяются на каждом углу, и выпадывают из многих врагов. В них нет никакой жесткой потребности, просто убивай врагов и аптечки сами подберутся. Да и напарники всегда помогут... порой даже танки за игрока взорвут, или выстригут целый взвод противника, пока игрок перезаряжается. В общем, уже с первой части Call of Duty стала тем, чем стала. Беги, стреляй, нет времени объяснять!

Обсуждать примитивную графику не имеет смысла, т.к. в свои годы игра наверняка могла удивить отличной анимацией, эффектными взрывами и высококачественными текстурами, но на сегодня игра выглядит откровенно слабо.
В глаза так же бросается убогая анимация солдатиков, которые очень-очень смешно бегают, словно игра создана для детей 10-12 лет. А раненые солдаты вообще передвигаются так, словно им отстрелили всё достоинство по самый корень. Если бы это не было так смешно, то не стал бы даже упоминать.

Еще мне не понравился звук. Не чувствуется объём, просто всё грохочет, словно все враги и союзники собрали вокруг тебя и просто дружно палят со всех стволов в разные стороны. Настоящая неразбериха даже в наушниках (тем более в наушниках).

Помимо американской кампании в игре доступна кампания за СССР. Именно за это Call of Duty очень тепло приняли, хотя, вроде бы, что в этом такого? Скажите лучше, почему наши отечественные разработчики не могут создать подобную игру про ВОВ, если среди наших игроков так много патриотически настроенных граждан, готовых ругать серию CoD лишь за отсутствие упоминания СССР в CoD:WW2? Впрочем, это риторический вопрос. Все эти "ТАВАРИЩИ!!" режут слух...
По разнообразию к игре никаких нареканий: перестрелка в посёлке, уничтожение техники, погони на грузовиках, пальба из зенитки по самолётам, захват и удержание точек на время, спасение военнопленных. Но в целом это просто типичный набор заданий, не обременных никаких общим сюжетом, всё просто тупо идёт своим чередом, как эпизодичные вставочки про бравых солдат времен Второй Мировой Войны. Нет ни сопереживания героям, не интереса к их личностям. В этом плане первая CoD ощутимо слаба, но возможно, так сказать, "киношность" серия обретает значительно позже.

Разумеется, игра 2003 года, технически не совершенна для современных систем - нет поддержки 1920х1080, но Google поможет решить эту проблему, так же, как и поможет найти русификатор, т.к. официально в Steam не продают локализованную версию с убогой русской озвучкой.

Первая часть популярного шутера вполне играбельна, хотя иногда и вызывает зевоту, но вполне даст развлечься даже самому привередливому игроку. В игре всего 25 миссий, которые очень скоротечны... некоторые проходятся настолько быстро, что в это трудно поверить... другие же искусственно растянуты (например, таймером, иногда нужно тупо отстреливать бесконечных врагов в течении нескольких минут). В целом на всё про всё уйдёт 4-5 часов.

39733955.review:
The Call of Duty franchise has come a long way since this game, and it is a lot of fun to go back and see the game that started one of the best selling video game franchises. The game is a lot different from newer titles, but is still a very good game. 

The game is set in World War 2, and feels very much like one of the Medal of Honor games. The campaign is a narrative story that follows a cast of named characters across different theatres of war. The campaign is fun, and provides a good story. 

The gameplay of the game is fun. The controls make sense, and the UI of the game is intuitive. The gunplay in the game is solid and feels realisitc. There is a good variety between all of the different weapons. Many of the weapons have multiple firing modes meaning that the selection of weapons feels even bigger. Additionally some weapons can be deployed or have other kind of special features to them which adds some very good complexity to the game. The heath system in the game is fair, and health packs are littiered fairly throughout levels. The difficulty of the game never felt too bad, and it can be changed if you desire a harder or easier game. 

The graphics on the game do show their age, but there is no way to really avoid that the game is old. The game does look visially good it is just low quality (if that makes sense). The graphics ran smoothly on my old computer which is by no means powerful. Im sure that no matter what machine you have you will be able to run the game smoothly, and even at the higher graphics level. 

I did have some issue when I first installed the game where I was unable to play it due to crashes. As time went on I belive that there may have been some kind of fix becuase I no longer have this issue, and I can play the game without it crashing before loading. I think this may have had something to do with Windows 7, so it is worth looking out for. I was lucky one time when I was trying to play it back then where it loaded, and I played the whole game in one sitting just to be safe. As I said before I think this issue is fixed, so you should not worry about it affecting your game however it is just something to look out for. Now with the return system if you can't run the game you can just return it, and I am sure that there are plenty of guides and forum posts that can help you get your game working if it doesn't.

I really love this game. The setting, campaign, and gameplay are all really great, and make for a great game. Even though I had some issues in the past with the game I still think that it is absolutly worth purchasing and playing.

this is where it all started, a fantastic ww2 shooter. in this relatively short 7 hour campaign you will play as an ordinary american, british and soviet soldier in some of the key battles of world war 2. wide variety of locations, environment, types of combat (short range, long range, tank combat) makes the campaign really interesting and you never really get bored. some of my favorite missions are the eder dam, battleship tirpitz and stalingrad. in this game you will meet cpt. price for the first time in cod franchise, as well as learn a little bit of history.
if you're looking for challenging campaign to beat - look no further. this can be extremely hard on veteran difficulty (if you're not using quick save all the time).
the only annoying thing about this game is absence of the mission select option after you've beaten the game.
15 years later, multiplayer is still active and a lot of fun.
i highly recommend this game if you're into fps games, especially if you need a little break from modern non-stop action shooters where you're mostly portrayed as some sort of super hero.
a classic piece of gaming history!

38714114.review:
Call of Duty is a first-person shooter taking place during World War II.  During this actioned packed Campaign, you will not only fight enjoy the Campaign and story line of the American Assault, but also the British and Soviet soldiers.  For a game that was released in 2003, Activision and Infinity Ward brought a lot of realism into the game. As you assault forward into and behind enemy lines while a relentless barrage of artillery fire and mortar rounds impacting around you, you will find yourself taking cover to overcome shellshock and regain awareness.

The American Campaign 

-	Brings you and your fellow comrades into the invasion of Normandy. Lack of sleep and male nourished, you fight your way through towns and villages eliminating all German enemy forces, securing the areas, and continuing your venture into the depths of the Nazi Front. Following your success in Normandy, you make your way to Bastogne, Belgium. (9 Missions)

The British Campaign

-	While the American Forces are assaulting the western front, British soldiers are assaulting the eastern front partnered with 1 Canadian Division.  Starting their mission near Benouville, British troops capture and defend key bridges the Germany Forces are utilizing to transport tanks into the central and western Forward Line of Troops. Following their success, British elements are tasked to take out Planes and most importantly, a German Naval Vessel, the Tirpitz, near Norway. Nearing the conclusion of the mission, British forces are tasked to destroy German Rockets in Burgsteinfurt, Germany. (7 Missions)

The Soviet Campaign

-	The first Soviet mission takes places during the Battle of Stalingrad.  You are unarmed and taking relentless machinegun and mortar fire. Once successfully ashore and the machinegun fire has been suppressed and eliminated, you find yourself flanking and neutralizing a German stronghold. During this campaign you are elected to take charge of a tank and maneuver throughout a Village, eliminated German Panzers. (10 Missions)

In conclusion this game was fantastic to play, everything from the realism of shellshock, ability to eliminate targets with a distant well sniper round, and assault bunkers conducting room clearing and hand to hand combat.  This game offers non-stop action-packed fighting to always keep you on your toes for 26 intense missions total and a variety of weapons. I would absolutely recommend this game for the simple fact or how engaged your will be at every moment.  The campaign does not take very long to beat but you will sure have fun playing it.  After checking the multiplayer servers, there is no-one who plays online.

38527583.review:
It's been such a long time since I played this, and I played the Xbox version way back when. Playing it on PC for the first time is wonderful. I didn't remember much about the game, so a lot of what I'm experiencing feels new, and nostalgia for this specific game isn't a factor, but nostalgia for this era of shooter design is.

Call of Duty feels intimate in a way that most other shooters can't do. You get verbal and written briefings, some even through you character's diary. The briefing often includes clueing you in to the overall strategy of the Allies and your small yet significant place in that strategy. The battles you fight aren't the ones that make headlines, but are the backbone of the offensive. You capture small towns and estates, and defend key points like bridges. The battles are small but feel personal, especially because your teammates' names show up when you point at them and the name changes in color to reflect their health. When Call of Duty goes for a dramatic moment, it doesn't wrestle control away from you. Rather, it fades in some melancholy orchestral music to fit the moment.

Call of Duty can play more run-and-gun or stop-and-pop depending on the difficulty level and the environment you're fighting in, with indoors being more of the former and outdoors being the latter. Weapons are still reasonably accurate even without aiming down the sights, which feels delightfully old-fashioned and is something that I dearly miss. Controls include leaning and going prone, both of which are useful in the game's indoor and outdoor battles. Sprinting is absent but that absensce isn't really noticable thanks to tight level design. Infinity Ward prefers to make a lot of short levels, something I prefer over a game with few long levels. My patience hasn't been tested by superfluous dialogue, cutscenes, or other ways to artificially inflate the length of game.

Quite simply, Call of Duty is a marvel of old-fashioned game design, built on the foundations of some of the best shooters ever made, then given its own identity as a shooter that sits confidently on the line between realistic shooters like Red Orchestra and Rainbow Six, and run-and-gun shooters like Quake and Half Life.

So as you can see by the hours played I am giving this game a thunbs up - however owing to the price I still do not recommend that you buy the game on its own. Buy the Warchest edition instead as you get this, the expansion and CoD 2 for only a fiver more.

With how the modern CoD franchise has turned out, it is easy to forget just how much this game changed video gaming at the time of its release. Melee and ADS on all weapons, excellent gunplay, good visuals, a full SP campaign with fanstastic pacing and story telling, and a great class based MP with a wide variety of maps. 

Also MP is actually still working with servers available, however the population playing is very small so don't buy just for the MP as you may be dissaponted.  So if your after a classic blast from the past this game delivers a great overall package - just be sure to buy the Warchest Edtion!

Bir yerde panzerfaust görürseniz hemen alın ve ana silahını dürbünlüye döndürün. Çünkü tank bir yerden fırlıyor. Oyun dönemine göre ve hikayeyi 3 farklı ulus üzerinden işlemesinden dolayı 10 üzerinden 9 diyebilirim. Bu oyundan sonra United Offensive ek pakedini oynarsanız çok iyi olur.

Nostalji, nostalji ve yine nostalji...

Medal of honor ekibinin ayrılması üzerine aynı dönemde yapılmaya başlayan call of duty serisi 2003 yılında gönlümüze tahtını kurmuştu. Playstationlarda az zamanımızı yemedi. Defalarca bitirmekten bıkmadığımız nadir oyunlardan biridir. Hikaye olarak ikinci dünya savaşında nazilere karşı çeşitli ülkelerde verilen mücadeleleri konu almaktayız. Ve en önemli noktalardan biride kurtardığımız cpt.Price ile ilk tanışma burada gerçekleşmektedir. 

Dönem savaş oyunlarının içerisinde bize sunmuş olduğu gerçekçilik şuan ciddi anlamda geri planda kalmış durumda. Neticeden üzerinden 14 yıl geçti fakat nostalji yaşamak için birebir. Araçlarla kaçarken verdği aksiyon, gemilerle çıkarma yaptığımız, dağın eteklerinde havan toplarından kaçarak ilerlemeye çalışmamız, tank sürerken verdiğimiz mücadele ve savunma bölümleri (ki en sevdiğim bölüm binayı savunduğumuz bölümdür) keyifle oynamaya teşvik ediyor.

Oyun zamanına göre değerlendirilmelidir ve türünün ilkleri arasında gerçekten başarılı bir yapım. Oyun süresi biraz kısa normal zorlukla 3-4 saatte rahatlıkla bitirilebilir. (puanım 2003 yılında playstationda oynarken aldığımız keyif üzerinedir) 10/8

35996843.review:
Das erste Call of Duty bietet einen großartig inszenierten Singleplayer, der im 2. Weltkrieg spielt. Missionen sind glaubwürdig inszeniert und lassen einen die Kampange aus verschieden Perspektiven der Allierten erleben. Dabei gibt es keine Skriptsequenzen, die das Gameplay unterbrechen. Die Action passiert BEIM Gamplay und ich habe immer die volle Kontrolle über das, was ich im Spiel tue, ohne dass ich von einer Cutscene bewegt werde. Es gibt auch keine HP Regeneration, was das Gampeplay sehr taktisch macht; vorstürmen und versuchen, alle abzuknallen, führt meistens zum sicheren Tod. Man muss also langsam vorgehen. Die HP können wir durch das Aufsammeln von Medi-Packs wieder auffüllen. Die Missionen spielen in unterschiedliche Gebieten und zu unterschiedlichen Jahreszeiten: So gibt es etwa eine Sniper Mission im Winter oder Schlachten in der Stadt. Für Abwechslung ist also gesorgt. In einer Mission fährt man auch Panzer oder man ist Schütze in einem Fahrenden Auto. Die Grafik ist heute natürlich veraltet, Animationen wirken etwas steif und Explosionen sehen auch nicht unbedingt realistisch aus. Die Grafik ist insgesamt aber immer noch ansehnlich. Allerdings ist das Gamplay hier nahezu perfekt und das ist wichtiger als Grafik.

Mein Fazit:
Sehr gut inszenierter Singleplayer, der das pure und realistisch inszenierte Gameplay eines zweiten Weltkriegsshooters in den Fokus rükt. Daher: Ganz klare Kaufempfehlung.

35980302.review:
Долгое время, именно «Medal of Honor» был ключевым шутером посвящённым теме Второй Мировой войне. За период с 1999 по 2003 год, вышло целых пять игр серии. Но на горизонте появился потенциальный конкурент, который вышел в 2003 году, буквально месяц спустя после релиза «Medal of Honor: Allied Assault Breakthrough». Речь идёт о «Call of Duty» производства «Infinity Ward», которая выпустила свой проект под крылом «Activision». 

Разница между «Call of Duty» и «Medal of Honor» довольно высока. Например, в проекте «Infinity Ward» всё действие сосредоточено сразу на трёх компаниях – за американцев, британцев и советов, что является большим плюсом. Это не только позволило показать различные эпизоды Второй Мировой от лица разных солдат, но и развязало руки дизайнерам уровней. Поэтому они варьируются от тесных помещений подземных бункеров и полуразрушенных зданий, до борта линкора «Тирпиц» и полуразрушенного Сталинграда. 

Какой-то срединной сюжетной линии нет, у нас просто набор миссий за солдат разных армий, где весь геймплей сосредоточен на уничтожении противника набором вооружения, которое существовало в эпоху Второй Мировой войны – от старого доброго ППШ-41 и винтовки М1 «Гаранд», до гранат и взрывчатки. Также игрокам дадут повоевать на танке, поучаствовать в диверсионной операциях, и погоне на грузовиках. 

Конечно, говорить о какой-либо исторической достоверности не приходиться, ибо «Call of Duty» хоть и основана на реальных событиях, тем не менее, сделана как игровая версия фильмов про войну – в частности, в некоторых миссиях угадываются отсылки в сторону сериала «Братья по оружию» и фильма «Враг у ворот». В принципе, от игры призванной развлечь игрока исключительно геймплеем в антураже Второй Мировой, большего и не требуется, и со своей задачей она справляется. А самое главное, «Call of Duty» вышла даже на порядок лучше, чем «Medal of Honor».

35975569.review:
Call of Duty is comprised of two modes: single-player and multi-player. In single-player, you'll have a great time playing difficult missions first as an American GI, then a Brit, and finally as a Russian. Most players can finish the game in a day or two. The graphics are intense (for a game using the Quake 3 engine), the sound simply amazing; you'll think you're on a virtual battlefield.
The AI is quite good, which makes for better variety than most first-person shooter games. Also, the ability to be part of a squad adds depth to the game, as you're no longer killing 200 soldiers by yourself. I recommend playing on the most difficult setting, as that is a definite challenge and will enhance your enjoyment of the single-player missions (and teach you the virtues of patience).

In multi-player mode is where Call of Duty really shines. You can compete against a host of players in a deathmatch or on a team (such as Germans vs. British). I have been playing multi-player for a few weeks now... it still gets my heart pounding when an unseen sniper is trying to take you down, or when you meet an opponent face-to-face.
My kudos to the designers, this game is certainly a piece of art.
Pro:
-amazing fast-paced action
-realistic sounds
-good AI
-great multi-player mode
-detailed maps

Cons:
-lack of a map editor

35928202.review:
Наткнулся на КОД в стиме случайно. Классическая игра про 2 Мировую войну, вышедшая в 2003 году, меня заинтриговала. Итак,
Плюсы:
1. Прекрасная подача отдельных уровней, например, высадка на берегу Сталинграда без оружия или установка красного знамени над Рейхстагом. Диалоги персонажей и вся сюжетная линия интересны и отлично сбалансированы.
2. Сложность геймплея. Игра действительно бросает вызов скилловым игрокам. И хотя у меня маленький опыт в играх этого жанра, я проходил КОД на предпоследнем уровне сложности, и легкой игра мне не показалась!
3. Захватывающая реалистичность, в основном проявляющаяся в советской кампании - суровая действительность войны: офицеры растреливают дезертиров, бегущих с поля боя, солдаты в страхе забиваются в углы, отчаянно бегут на укрепления немцев и толкаются в очереди получения винтовок.
4. Графика. Конечно, графика игры 2003 года особо никого не удивит, но тем не менее она приятная глазу и вполне играбельна.
Минусы:
1. Большинство сюжетной линии занимает кампания американцев, в основном соло диверсии или малые стычки. Крупные операции только две: высадка парашютистов в начале и оборона моста. Наиболее интересна советская компания, однако ей уделено малое время от общего игрового процесса.
2. Невозможность сделать рывок в определенном направлении иногда доставляет небольшие неудобства.
В целом игра оставляет о себе очень и очень приятное впечатление. Рекомендую ли я в нее поиграть? Да, 7\10.
Рекомендую ли я ее купить за существующую цену? Скорее да, чем нет, 6,5\10.

35833928.review: Before playing this, I had only played CoDs between World ar War to Advanced Warfare, and I was curious to see how Call of Duty first started out.  I had heard that "it doesn't try to make you out as some kind of war hero," and that is somewhat true.  It definitely has some action sequences, and t one point you single-handedly take out a small base, but there definitely parts which have a clear message: real war isn't a game, it's brutal slaughter.  To me, there is one part where this really stands out: the beginning of the russian campaign.  I feel this part really shows that message well.  Basically, the original CoD was a fun game, and actually a breath of fresh air, compared to the newer shooters.  Part of this is the game is old, and I like playing old games like this and Half Life, but not everyone does.  However, if you can look past the dated visuals, and somewhat dated mechanics, Call of Duty classic is a fun game, and I recommend it be played, at least to see where Call of Duty came from, and how it has changed over the years.

35408421.review:
8/10 建议打折买入

+优秀的战场气氛渲染
+宏大的战争场面
+借鉴兵临城下，兄弟连的经典桥段

-画面目前看来比较落伍

这是PC平台使命召唤系列的第一部，也是第一次让玩家以一名普通士兵的视角经历大型的战场（更早的荣誉勋章系列还是以特种小队作战为主，同屏士兵人数很少，虽然战场氛围渲染也很好，但大场面还是使命召唤1代给我的震撼最大）

03年我上初中，爸爸给我买了一盒正版盒装作为生日礼物，当时玩需要放光盘，我把单人战役通了不下十遍，我爸也自己通关了好几遍。最后暑假在家玩多人联机时间太长，光盘炸在光驱里了...

这部游戏给我的震撼是其他游戏都没法比拟的，把同学带到家里的研究生机房联机，3v3可以打一天，真是童年最快乐的回忆之一。

这款游戏在首发时期完全可以给10/10，现在画面减2分，其他素质依旧过硬，喜欢二战的朋友还是推荐试一试，感受下射击游戏王者的发家之作。

9년전쯤 내가 처음으로 했었던 FPS

마트에서 CD로 판매했었는데 직접 샀었음. 두번째로 산 정품은 스타크래프트 1.

처음으로 했던 FPS이자 처음으로 구매한 정품 게임.
당시 구매한 CD는 2개 분할로 설치해야 하는데 지금은 1-파티션 CD가 없음.

한글화 되있던 CD였는데 아쉽게도 스팀판은 한글화 안되있음.
근데 지금으로썬 나오는 영어는 그닥 어렵지않기에 굳이 한글패치 안해도되고

뭣보다 나는 한번 정주행을 마치면 그 게임은 대부분 관짝으로 처박혀서
어지간하면 다시 꺼내질않지만 유독 이 게임만큼은 수십번이고 정주행을 했음.
체감상 50번은 넘긴거같음. 진짜로.

그때문인지 게임 스토리라인과 이벤트를 거의 다 외워버릴 정도로 반복해서 했지만
유독 콜옵1 만큼은 질리지가 않음. 덕분에 적 위치랑 등장지점까지 다외움.

모던워페어3 도 비슷하게 정주행을 여러번했지만 나한텐 1 만큼의 재미는 못따라가는것 같음.

내생각엔 체력 시스템의 영향이 큰거같음.
1 은 헬스킷으로 체력을 회복하는 시스템이라서 쳐맞고 쉬고 반복이 불가능해서인지 매우 긴장되고 몰입이 잘됨.
별도의 체력시스템이 있는 게임만의 장점인듯. 울펜슈타인같은거 말고

가장 재미있었던 미션은
영국군 시나리오에서 스텐하나들고 댐으로 잠입,
달리는 트럭에서 판처파우스트를 갈기는 추격전,
시간을 달리는 프라이스 대위님이랑 독일군 전함 티르피츠? 잠입,
소련군 미션 역시 시작부터 옆에 수송선 터져나가고
벽돌뒤에 숨어있는 저격수 아재 타이밍 못맞춰서 기총소사에 갈려나가고.

그래픽에 그닥 신경안쓰는 타입이라서 상관은 없지만
찰흙같은 그래픽에 나온지 십년이 넘은 고전게임이라고 무시하지는 말자.

만약 당신이 FPS를 좋아한다면,
십중팔구 콜옵1 을 했을것이고,
콜옵1 을 했다면,
이 게임을 잊을수 없을것이다.



원래 아군 조준하면 공격이 안되는데
백병전 휘두르는 선딜레이로 팀킬해서 탄약 챙겨가는짓을
모던워페어까지 가서도 안바꾸는거보면 제작진들도 똑같은짓 하는듯.

34868874.review:
Just played through the campaign for the first time. I have played other Call of Duty games before this one before but decided to go ahead and buy the original, to really see where it all started. I have to say that this game holds up well, at least the campaign does. I can't speak for the multiplayer for I haven't played it. The soundtrack was great, the gameplay is pretty smooth, the characters and the voice acting is good for its time. I mean sure the character models are a bit boxy, the graphics aren't great by today's standards, and you are pretty limited in terms of weapons and movement as was the case with most games when this came out. 

All in all, I think this is a great game and will probably play this again on a harder difficulty in the future. I totally recommend this game for anyone who can appreciate the origins of a franchise such as this one or like ones such as Medal of Honor. Oh and by the way, I got this on a sale, which I recommend people interested in any game to do, but having played the campaign and looking back, I think the $20 is worth it, especially if you are willing to replay it on a harder setting.

34514658.review:
+:
1) Начало начал. В далеком 2003 вышла очередная игра про вторую мировую войну. Классика проверенная временем.
2) Крайне удачная подача отдельных уровней. Один Сталинград (хоть и скопирован с фильма Враг у ворот) крайне врезается в память. А весь геймплей просто трудно понять с первого раза, так как интерес происходящего не дает сосредоточиться.
3) Эта игра - серьёзный вызов для хардкорных игроков. То, что была добавлена Save/Load сохранений, крайне полезная вещь, особенно на высоких уровнях сложности. Как игрок, прошедший игру на Ветеране, нашедший все чекпоинты и сохранивший на всех них 100 едениц здоровья, невероятно ценю эту опцию.
4) Довольно динамичный геймплей для своего времени.
-:
1) Невозможность бега. Иногда очень нужно, чтобы герой побежал, но этого сделать просто невозможно.
2) Баги при запуске как для основной игры, так и для дополнения. Некоторым пользователям, чтобы поиграть в игру, приходится переименовывать файл запуска с CoDSP на MOHAA. И при том, запустить со Steam игру невозможно, а следовательно в мультиплеер уже не поиграть.
3) Довольно-таки серые однородные цвета, из-за чего всё кажется иногда скучным и нудным.
4) Отвратительная официальная локализация русского языка. К счастью, не всем плевать на это.

Call of Duty. Конвеер, конечно же. Но разве это меняет факт того, что игра великолепна? Разумеется, нет. Первая часть определенно стоит вашего внимания. К тому же, как я сказал ранее, это классика. Не поиграть в самую первую часть CoD  это так же, как не поиграть в GTA Vice City.
К покупке - рекомендуется.

34235280.review:
Un classique du FPS WW2 dira-t-on, certes, sauf que le jeu a vieilli, très mal dirai-je. Nous sommes placés dans de la mécanique à l'ancienne, du FPS comme avant, dont le style peut en calmer plus d'un. Outre une réalisation qui pour l'époque avait scotché beaucoup de monde, il en resort que le titre d'IW présente quand même du défauts. Des points négatifs qui m'ont sans aucun doute gaché mon expérience de joueur assidu (en plus !).

Au vu de l'ancienneté du titre, il m'a été impossible de jouer à la résolution souhaitée et quand bien même je me suis rapproché de celle-ci, j'ai eu droit à un rétrecissement de l'écran de jeu. De quoi coller ses yeux sur  l'écran pour déceler le moindre ennemi.
 J'ai volontairement choisi le troisième mode de difficulté, pensant que ça allait améliorer mon expérience de jeu... Il n'en est rien ! Bien au contraire, les ennemis connaissaient ma position à l'avance, vous balancent deux pruneaux bien placés pour avoir sorti une oreille et le focus est quasiment persistant du début à la fin. Cependant, les coups d'oeil à droite et à gauche semblent la meilleure solution afin d'engager les adversaires.
Les missions se finissent généralement seul, on notera une espérance de vie des alliés très faible. Les tirs fratricides et les lancés de grenades échoués peuvent eux aussi faire baisser l'expérience de votre matériel informatique...
De plus des baisses de framerate sont à constater ici et là, pourtant les graphismes commencent à vraiment faire vomir. 
Recommandé pour les fans de la série et les rétro gamers, probablement pas aux néophites des FPS.

34034251.review:
[b]Intro[/b]
Like Medal of Honor, but called Call of Duty.
One of the best WWII shooters I've played that has aged decently well. Works best when it makes you feel more like just another soldier instead of the missions where you feel like James Bond, but either way the game is gorgeous and really just a lot of fun. Veteran may feel a bit cheap at first but keep playing and you'll get the hang of it and realize that for the most part it's pretty fair.

[b]The Great:[/b]
++Fantastic sound design
++Gorgeous, colourful graphics that still look really nice today
++Game runs like a dream on modern hardware and operating systems

[b]The Good:[/b]
+Brilliant first-person animations
+Back when Call of Duty could be lighthearted and not dead serious the whole game. A welcome change for what most people would expect in the series in that regard. Can bring the seriousness of the war when required.
+Shows three different sides of the war, all handled decently well. Pretty unique concept for WWII shooters.
+The only CoD where you can quick-save
+Set-pieces are handled well
+Weapon variety is decent
+Voice-acting is of high quality

[b]The Okay/Not Too Big of a Deal:[/b]
+-Run of the mill multiplayer, but it's still enjoyable
-+Veteran is strange in that health
+-I don't miss health regeneration when there's no health kits on Veteran and there's waves and waves of enemies, but it's not too much of a big deal. I also imagine it wouldn't be too annoying on easier difficulties either.
-+Characters can be humourous and are likeable, but only appear very, very shortly

[b]The Bad:[/b]
-Animations were always pretty dated
-Singleplayer is far too short. Lasts only about 5 hours on Veteran.
-I've always found weapons to not feel impactful enough in the CoD games. This is no exception.
-Campaign pacing is poor
-Not a lot of weaponry and you'll be using the same ones constantly across all factions since the best ones are so rare

[b]The Horrible:[/b]
--Game gets repetitive and tiring quickly
--Ridiculously linear to the point where it's just stupid. Even moreso than the rest of the games. You cannot fall off ledges, you cannot mantle waist high walls and there is one direct path and that's it throughout the entire game.

Sound: 10/10
Graphics: 9/10
Gameplay: 8/10
Content/Replayability: 3/10
Overall: 8/10

[b]Conclusion[/b]
Very worth playing, although in all honestly, you wouldn't be missing much by just playing Call of Duty 2 instead. But if you like that and want more then this should easily fill your needs. A really great WWII FPS.

33149263.review:
This is a complete classic. Some of the developers worked on the classic title Medal of Honor Allied Assault. They took everything that was great about that game and made it better. This is where the impressively successful Call of Duty series got its start and is still plenty playable and enjoyable today. This is the one and only in the series to feature the traditional health system with non-regenerating hit points and medkits placed strategically around the maps.

The game is very much similar to other titles in the Call of Duty series aside from the health system. The bad parts though are the really crappy audio (unrealistic gun sounds and overpowered explosion sounds which drown out some of the dialogue) and the horrendous animations which definitely did NOT stand the test of time.

This is still a classic game in my opinion that all should experience. This is the title that in my opinion simply killed the original Medal of Honor series.

33111984.review: A fantastic game! The campaign is full of action, cinematic moments, corner peeking, and historical moments. The missions are old and the graphic dated, but they still deliever a fun game. The Russian campaign was really gruesome and fun! 33099465.review:
The game that started it all. Short, scripted, intensive campaign that is all about the experience and the feeling of being one of many. 13 years later, the graphics and physics are quite dated but the single player is still fun to play. 32973159.review:
It's extremely dated. That in itself doesn't make it a bad game, but the barely functional AI and game's reliance on giving enemies xray vision to make them provide a challenge doesn't fly very well with me.
Base game is mostly a corridor shooter and restart-from-checkpoint-for-500th-time simulator. Expect to get killed a lot right after someone says "we'll cover you while you do X" - especially in the final level.
As someone decided to point in the midst of immature insults, there is a quicksave button. But that doesn't solve anything. You either get a checkpoint sim or a mash-quicksave sim. I cannot imagine relying on quicksave on every corner as a fun experience, since you'll be stopping every few moments to manually set your own checkpoint down for when the AI inevitably screws you over.

United Offensive expansion somewhat salvages the base game by featuring much larger scale battles where the friendly and enemy AI will be more often than not too busy shooting eachother for the enemy to be zeroing in on you exclusively.

This game is only for those with tight nostalgia goggles or blindness to the fact that spending more time pressing quicksave or replaying the same chokepoint for the 500th time is not fun at all. If you want something from this franchise that is old but still very serviceable, consider CoD2.

32017990.review:
8 yıl sürecek bir efsanenin başlangıcı...

Öncelikle oyun eski olmasına rağmen zamanında birçok oyunda olmayan mekaniklere ve grafiklere sahip. Yani zamanına göre değerlendirmek gerekirse gerçekten yüksek bir puanı hakediyor ama yıl olmuş 2017 oyun çıkalı 14 yıl olmuş. O yüzden şuan almak isteyenler için değerlendiricem oyunu. 

[h1] Hikaye [/h1]

2. Dünya Savaşı'nı anlatıyor ve oyunu birçok ulusun gözünden farklı karakterleri kullanarak görüyoruz. Zaten yapımcıları Medal of Honor: Allied Assault'u yapan kişiler yani oyunlar arasındaki benzerlik aşırı derecede belli oluyor hatta öyleki 1ini oynadıktan sonra diğerini oynadığımda "Lan bunların aynısını yaptım ordada niye tamamen aynı şeyi yapıyoruz?" dedim. Sonra araştırdığımda yapımcıların aynı olduğunu öğrendim. Hikaye ile ilgili pek söylenecek birşey yok aslında dediğim gibi 2. Dünya Savaşı'nı anlatıyor ve bu işi güzel yapmış.

[h1] Grafikler [/h1]

Grafikler günümüze göer çok eskimiş olsada o zamanlar için ciddi anlamda kaliteli grafiklerdi. Öyleki bence Mount&Blade grafiklerinden daha kaliteli grafiklere sahip. Karakterlerin gözleri yapıştırma değil göz kapakları var. Hit boxlar gerçekten çok iyi mesela o dönemde tel bir çitin arkasındaki adamı görüpte ateş ettiğimizde tellerin arasında hayali bir duvara çarpıyordu mermiler ama bu oyunda öyle değil eğer teli vurmazsanız arkaya geçiyor mermi.

[h1] Oynanış [/h1]

Çömelmek yere yatmak olsun günümüz oyunlarının birçok mekaniği mevcut. Sadece depar atmak yok eh oda olmasın artık. Silahların isabet oranları geri tepme/sekme oranları gayet iyi. Şarjör değiştirme olayları zaten günümüzünkiyle aynı yani 5+5lik bir şarjörde 3 merminiz kaldıysa ve şarjör değiştirdiyseniz merminiz 10 olmuyor. Boş olan 5'lik çıkartılıp yerine dolu 5'lik takılıyor ve 8 merminiz oluyor. Mermilerin tek tek silaha takıldığı durumlarda ise şarjör doldurmayı yarıda kesebiliyorsunuz. Örneğin keskin nişancı tüfeği kullanıyorsunuz merminiz bitti sizde şarjör değiştiriyorsunuz tam o anda karşınıza biri çıktı hemen doldurmayı bırakıp silahın içine hali hazırda kaç mermi koyduysanız kullanabiliyorsunuz.

[h1] Çeşitlilik [/h1]

Günümüz oyunlarıyla kapışamayacak düzeyde olsada bence ciddi anlamda çok çeşitli bir oyun gerek görev gerek silahlar olsun her dakka m1 grand alıp şu adamı öldür görevinde değilsiniz. Gerektiğinde bir binayı temizliyorsunuz gerektiğinde bir pozisyonu destek birlikler gelene kadar tutuyorsunuz. Bazı görevlerde keskin nişancı silahı kullanıyorsunuz bazılarında makinalı tüfekleri vs vs.

Şimdi en son tabiki puanımı belirticem. Bu puana Cpt. Price etkiside var ;) 71 SP

Edit: Oyunun hala multiplayer oyuncusu var ve oynanıyor. Bizzat kendim 3-4 farklı serverda 20-30 kişiyle oynadım.

Diğer incelemer için [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/21404902-Lojman-Gaming] buraya tıklayın. [/url]

The first CoD in all its glory.
The graphics are terribly outdated now, but the rest of the game is very playable even today (thanks to the glorious Quake-3-Engine).

The level design is quite diverse and the scripted events in the levels aren't as many as there are in today's CoD which means you can enjoy them more. And it feels a little more "realistic" since there is no regenerative health and endless respawning enemies in this game.

Give it a try if you want to know how the series started.
And yes: the single-player campaign can be beaten in 3 hours and the add-on "United Offensive" is missing for some reason.

I haven't tried the multiplayer with my Steam-version of the game but from what I still can recall from some years ago it was basically a somewhat slower Quake 3 with nicely designed maps. Although I have no idea if there are any players online.

31897272.review:
Though the franchise has undergone many time-period changes through its 14 year existence, the original Call of Duty heralded the true beginning of a gaming era; one that brought on an onslaught of World War II first-person shooters. It also helped to birth the hardcore FPS multiplayer scene that we know today, since the series focused more on an online experience than an in-depth campaign. It's with the first Call of Duty title, released in 2003, that we see many of the staples that the franchise has carried on for the last decade and a half, including the unmistakable "death" sound, and the floundering campaign that bridges between multiple main characters and regiments; though it's important to note that this title comes equipped with an actual health bar, rather than a regenerating life mechanic.

In single-player mode, there are three campaigns to be enjoyed; American where you control Private Martin during the years of 1942-1944, British which follows the journey of Sergeant Jack Evans during 1944, and Soviet Union that chronicles Corporal Alexei Ivanovich Voronin's experience during the Battle of Stalingrad, up through the years of 1942-1945. Each of these campaigns, which span across 26 levels, bring fast-paced, action-driven content to the table that was considered unique at the time that this title was released. Whether you're in a speeding car and avoiding being gunned down by the enemy, infiltrating underground bunkers, or controlling a tank, or sneaking onto an enemy ship as a spy, there's always something fun waiting for you.

Surprisingly, the graphics and amazing atmosphere still hold up in this advanced day and age; as do the mechanics and AI. In fact, the AI in Call of Duty is better than some of its successors, your allies that help you gun down your foes will actually hit them and help you to proceed, rather than just firing in the general direction of the enemy, leaving you to do all of the work. The enemy AI is so well done that it can be frustrating at times, especially those on mounted machine guns as they will tend to target you, even if you're hiding behind cover, despite your 10+ comrades who are doing the conga-line out in the open. Also worthy of a mention, the optimization is fantastic, and the game runs smooth as butter even on Windows 10. However, the sound is another story; there are no separate option sliders for sound effects, music, and voice. This leads to the gunfire completely overwhelming any spoken dialogue, and largely overtaking the few music tracks that are present.

Although I personally did not partake in the Call of Duty multiplayer, it's included and the servers are still functional if that's something that you're interested in. It's your run-of-the-mill basic deathmatch kind of multiplayer, and even for its time it was extremely barebones; don't purchase this game with the expectations of anything that even remotely resembles the Modern Warfare series and onward. More realistic expectations would be to brace yourself for a World War II themed Unreal Tournament experience if anything. There also aren't a lot of people online, so it's best to only consider purchasing this game if you want to play the single-player campaign.

Even though 14 years have passed since it was originally released, Call of Duty still stands firm as a landmark title that spawned a plethora of World War II FPS clones. It revolutionized the FPS genre at the time, with its unique action segments that exceeded the boundaries of the standard run-and-gun titles that surrounded it. If you're a fan of the series and are tired of the latest deviations in the franchise, or if you've never played the original, come back to basics with this title. If you're a fan of World War II shooters, then this will most certainly be an unforgettable experience for you. The only downside is that the ending is a bit anti-climactic, but other than that Call of Duty is a true classic that must be played.

31657863.review:
The one that started it all.  Of all the Call of Duty games, this one has by far the best AI.  They utilize formations and cover well, and they seem to better acknowledge what each other is doing.  You won't find multiple soldiers dynamically fragging an MG nest for example, only one will attempt it while others cover.  

This is also the only CoD game to my knowledge that has a fire selector for guns, otherwise it plays much like the other WWII CoD games.  Portable support weapons are not available to the player, that was introduced in United Offensive, its expansion.

You play as an American in France, Belgium, and Germany, as well as a British soldier in France, Norway, and Germany, and also a Russian soldier in Russia and Germany.  You take part in major battles like Operation Overlord, Stalingrad, Battle of the Bulge, and more, many of which are covered by other CoD games as well so expect some repetition in that regard.  The game includes car chases and a tank segment, stealth operations of various kinds, a bit more mission and terrain variety than other CoD games (especially the WWII ones).  

It shares some of the same limitations with its successors as well, such as the less than impressive physics, very limited environmental interaction, excessive invisible walls, unrealistic reliance on the player (e.g. you will be told to use a mounted MG and then switch to a Panzerfaust when tanks show up, forced gameplay variety at the expensive of realism).

This game, United Offensive, and CoD 2 are the only ones to my knowledge that use DirectSound3D and Creative EAX 3, so you better use a sound card and select Creative EAX 3 as the sound device.  This results better positional audio as every sound is processed in 3D space, and dynamic environmental effects not present in the ones after CoD 2 like echoes/reverb and more.

Be sure to get United Offensive as well and use Marcomix's Real Weapons mod, which is compatible with both.  This adds much needed weapon variety to the game, and a bit more authenticity as well.

http://www.moddb.com/mods/marcomixs-real-weapons

Although lacking any offficial multiplayer support this is by far the best of the franchise and in my opinion the only game worth buying at full price. Even for those new to the series I highly recommend you play on the hardest difficulty for the best experience.

Pros:

- Tons of interesting weapons and vehicles to mess around with.
- Experience WW II from various factions involved: British, Russian, and American                
- Graphics have aged quite well
- Excellent map and sound design make for an immersive experience.
- Vast Array of mission types: Sniping, Sneaking, Scavenging, Charging, Infiltrating, Blitzkrieging, Assaulting, and Defending. There's something for the whole family! 
- No wallrunning, jetpacks, or other goofy shennanigans!
- No Rambo tactics like in other games. Your squad is there for you (most of the time)

Cons:

- Other than trying to win WW II the story is kind of forgettable
- Compared to the character development in its successors it's simply just not there for this one (Don't expect to get to know Price's Grandaddy in this one) 
- To many the scale of the battles and map sizes may be disappointing but Infinityward did a great job with 'smoke and mirrors'  considering the now primitive tech they had to work with and develop for.

Overall: Althought there isn't much replayability this game was a ride well worth the enrty price. For those new to FPS's this a great start and to the Veterans of the series this will be a refreshing experience. If this game goes on sale DO NOT hestitate to buy it. Anyways, have fun shootin' and punchin' ACTUAL Nazis and ACTUAL Facsists!

30452140.review:
[u]What I liked about the game[/u] 
[list]
[*]	I like the idea of having three campaigns, were you can play as three different soldiers from three different countries (America, Britain, and Russia). Each country has its own weapons, and you can also pick up and use the Axis weapons as well (MG42 and MP40).

[*]	The combat is fun, intense and satisfying, especially if you are using a rifle; performing head shots.  

[*]	Some memorable missions; like operation overload. 

[*]	I like the idea behind the cut-scenes were it shows you historical WW2 footage, and I also like the idea that you can read the soldiers diary or their briefing form before the mission. 

[*]	A great variety of missions; like for example in one mission you get to drive a T-34 tank and in another mission you are on a truck firing a bazooka. 

[*]	Great soundtrack; goes well with the gameplay.

[*]	Great arsenal of weapons; they were all actually used during WW2 and each country has its different weapons. 

[u]What I disliked or was disappointed with[/u] 

[*]	Don't get me wrong this is a fantastic game, which is well made; there was never a dull moment in it, but it's a lot of money for what it is. If it had included United Offence, then it probably would have been worth it. I managed to complete the game in less than 7 hours. You probably be better of buying this game at a discount. 

[*]	Some of the missions are too short. 

[*]	Sometimes you can't jump over obstacles; like fences and sandbags. You can't also jump through windows. 

[*]	Sometimes it just feels like your doing all the work. 
[*]	 I hate having to equip the grenade to throw it; would have been better if you could just press g to throw the grenade. 
[/list]
[u]Conclusion[/u] 

A fantastic game, but too expensive for a 2003 game. If you are a fan of WW2 games or FPS, then this game is a must buy, but maybe wait till the game is discounted.  

  
[h1]92/100[/h1]

Jogo muito bom sobre tema da segunda guerra mundial, tecnicamente falando o jogo ainda é bem atual, claro tirando que ainda neste CoD aqui você ainda precisa de kits médicos para curar-se, mas nada que atrapalhe de fato; a jogabilidade flui bem e se tu jogar com caltela real (aquela que não é de um gamer que arrisca o bot porque sabe que ele vai da respaw, ou seja, reviver), você passara as fases sem muitas dificuldades, só uma que me deixou muito irritado  (não tanto quanto vocês devem esta imaginando) foi a de uma ponte que tinhamos que segurar um ofensiva inimiga por 4 minutos e meio (por aí), era mais inimigo do que amigos pra te ajudar, mas se você for um jogador atento  vai passar de boa (ou nem tanto).
Já a história do game é ok, mas o forte dele são realmente os momentos baseados na segunda guerra que aconteceu de fato, muitos documentos com fotos são mostrados e não vou mentir pra vocês, chegou a escorrer algumas lágrimas no final; afinal de contas, foram muitas, mas muitíssimas vidas perdidas tanto de civis quanto de soldados e daí você se pega perguntando,  "pra que tudo isso?" Sei que meu lado cristão acabou afrorando mais e fiquei muito pensativo no final do game e com mais fé em Deus e menos no homem.
Veredíto: o Jogo é bom sim, com momentos que fazem lembrar filmes de guerra (com cenas e músicas épicas) e outros uma guerra real (aquele momento que se você se apreçar sem pensar vai morrer) e nós sabemos que numa guerra não funciona assim.
Traduções podem ser baixadas e instaladas. 
Os gráficos eram top na época (2003) e ainda são bons pros dias de hoje.
8.5 é minha nota final.

Помню, как давным-давно увидел прохождение этой игры на когда-то существовавшем телеканале "Первый Игровой". Я даже не знал, что это за игра. Позже я её увидел в гостях у друга, попробовал немного поиграть, правда ничего толкового тогда не вышло. Спустя ещё какое-то время я приобрёл её в Steam и прошёл до конца. Готов высказаться о ней. 
Графика. Конечно, такой графикой нынешнее поколение геймеров не привлечёшь, но тогда, я думаю, это было что-то невероятное. Дизайн уровней классный. Чувствуется атмосфера того времени и то, что ты на фронте. 
Озвучка. Хорошая английская озвучка. Есть и русский акцент, и британский. Звук оружия приятный. Куча взрывов и выстрелов. Музыка героическая. 
Сюжет. Действия происходят во время Второй Мировой войны. Играем за нескольких персонажей: рядового Красной Армии, армии Соединённого Королевства и армии США. Достаточно захватывающий и интересный сюжет. 
Геймплей. Простой и понятный: мочим нацистов. И стараемся своих не подстрелить, ибо это военное время, и предателей не прощают. 
Классика жанра military FPS, положившая начало одной из ныне популярных серий, которую стоит приобрести и пройти, дабы посмотреть, с чего началась эта серия:)

29559000.review:
Call of Duty Review

Call of Duty as a series is probably not respected today as it once was, but I do think it's important to take a look back every so often and see how older games in a series hold up. Especially a series that at one time was revered as much as some of the best military shooters out there today, if not more so. 

The original Call of Duty is structured a bit differently than your typical modern Call of Duty. Your modern Call of Duty follows a three act structure for a majority of its campaigns and this can tend to make them a bit predictable in terms of story structure. This Call of Duty does have three campaigns, but each one has it’s throughs and valleys, which in turn creates three distinct experiences. Something that the later Call of Duty’s fail to evoke. One could look at it as a three-act structure, but I look at it as a unique structure. A way to tell a story that only a game could. 

For the most part the campaign is hardly ever mundane or boring, and I don’t really like saying that as some of these missions were actually done. So it feels odd to criticize something that at one point in time had real stakes involved. However I think, that ultimately Infinity Ward’s choice to include these missions gives the original Call of Duty an air of authenticity that is severely lacking in the modern Call of Duty’s. 

Going through the campaigns 20 or so levels is a breeze. Clocking in at around 8-9 hours plus another 5 or 6 with the United Offensive expansion. It’s a decently long game and definitely worth the money if it’s on sale. 

Call of Duty may be a bit hard for some newer fans, but if you power through it, you’ll enjoy yourself. I for one was enthralled and taken aback when I saw what these brave men did for our country. It’s not like the game is an exact recreation of war events, but it gives you an idea how it must of been for these people. A very slight idea as I’d imagine it’s nothing like the real thing.  And thus this gives the original Call of Duty a timeless quality. It’s something you can look back to and be able to experience just how bad this world can get. It’s a lesson and warning for all time. It’s poignant in such a way that modern Call of Duty’s can never be. This doesn’t mean that later Call of Duty’s are bad it just means they are missing one thing that makes the original all the better for it.

28959748.review:
Let's be honest with ourselves. 

It's 2017 now. You install this game and start playing, it's simplistic, it looks like crap, it's unrealistic, and it's silly. There's nothing realistic about it. It won't seem innovative to you. It's just a primitive old shooter with the Call of Duty name attached to it. While there may be those for whom this game generates intense nostalgia value, in reality, playing this right now compared to all the wonderful games that have come after it, one asks--why? The campaign isn't particularly compelling. It's pretty much just roleplaying as Band of Brothers. There's certainly better World War II games out there (Red Orchestra, even World at War) so there's really no point to get it, unless you want to see where Call of Duty came from. It's not like the campaign in this game has any bearing on the present iterations of the series. 

Really, all you need to know is that this was the first Call of Duty game. Beyond that, it has little value for us now.

28885442.review:
Who is this Game For?
==================
It’s hard to point to any one single aspect of Call of Duty as the reason that it is such an enjoyable game. It’s not a particularly innovative game, but rather does an excellent job of bringing together all of the best facets of World War II shooters and wrapping it all in top-notch level design. Who cares about innovation when you’re having so much fun? Anyone who’s a fan of FPS or the Call of Duty series in general should give the game a try, picking it up when discounted on Steam.

Is it good?
=================
Call of Duty provides a mix of realism and arcade elements that work together nicely to provide a great gameplay experience.  A well-placed shot or two will be able to bring you down, but you can actually take a fair amount of damage and there are health packs scattered about the level or dropped by the dead that can restore you to full strength. If the game's missions could be described in a word, that word would be intense.  Right from the start you'll be in the thick of things, outnumbered and facing withering fire from the enemy.  In just the first few missions you'll have to assault bunkers, take out Wirbelwind Flakpanzers protected by machine gun nests, and face the devastating fire of a Tiger tank's cannon and machine gun.  If you think that's tough, wait until you reach the Russian missions.  In a sequence obviously inspired by Enemy at the Gates, you'll have to cross the Volga River into the heart of the maelstrom in Stalingrad ... and do so without a gun.  Throughout the campaign the game doesn't let up, moving you from one action-packed mission to the next.

The game is also mod friendly with a pretty decent following still. There are a few interesting mods that improve just the graphics and sounds including Extreme Mod Light [2013] and CoD Realism Enhancement.

Does it have any problems?
========================
The game requires PunkBuster update to play on protected servers which are no longer hosted on EvenBalance's website. Even still, the multiplayer is actually pretty active for such an old game. Just make sure you get the United Offensive expansion pack since that’s where most of the multiplayer servers need. 

A big word of warning though, a lot of people have experienced problems running the game on newer hardware, one of the biggest problems when trying to play older games. The biggest problem is a buffer overflow with newer Nvidia hardware and Intel HD cards (http://pcgamingwiki.com/wiki/Call_of_Duty#Buffer_Overrun_error_on_start-up). These issues can be fixed, so if you do have errors, please check the PC Gaming Wiki link for the fix.

Final Thoughts!
====================
It was all too easy to peel away the layers of glitz and gloss and come up with a long list of inconsistencies, flaws and slightly irksome design decisions. Though, combining an authentic look, sound and feel with a simple interface and innovative game play mechanics it’s no wonder that this game spawned a legacy that has lasted till now and this game is still one of the best WWII FPS.

27774192.review:
The game is worth the buy and the playthrough if only to see how far the series has come and how completely off base its become. The mechanics and inclusion of somewhat intelligent AI blows its main competitor at the time (Medal of Honor) out of the water. The environments/maps are also quite massive, but are not as diverse as the MoH titles were. Though the missions were straight forward, the story is pretty weak. Clearly, IW recognized this as the big issue when trying to combine the game aspects of how to fight and what you’re fighting for, and this became perfected later on in the series in later iterations.

For some reason, what really stuck out to me about this game (even after playing countless modern FPSs) is how smooth the vehicle combat was.  It was fair for the most part, but you’d get hit randomly and it would raise the stakes enough for you to make your shots count and rely on the game’s minimalist in-car cover system. 

It felt better than 9 out of the 10 scripted car chases in games these days. I guess they just don’t make them like they used to. 

I should also note that you can play these games on your monitor’s native resolution. You just have to mess around with the .cfg file under the display height and width settings.

27220020.review:
In 1998, came out a game known as Half Life. It revolutionized the FPS genre by providing a narrative element. Along with that came the linear level design, since you cannot have proper storytelling without one. No more would the player just run around in the maze-like level design, picking off enemies, collecting keys and finding the exit to the next level. Love it or hate it, but what we know today as FPS is all thanks to Half Life.

After Half Life, many games have come out with mechanics very similar to Half Life. Medal of Honor and Call of Duty were one of them.

It's important to note that Medal of Honor franchise was started up by Steven Spielberg himself - it has its roots in N64's Goldeneye. To be exact, Steven was inspired to make the game after he saw his son playing Goldeneye. Early Medal of Honor's would come out only on PS1, and would look very similar to Goldeneye. That said, in 2002 they would release Medal of Honor Allied Assault - made from ground up for pc. The most iconic moment of that game was the omaha beach level - copied straight out of the Saving Private Ryan movie. Unlike the older FPS games, it was very atmospheric, and that's all thanks to the narrative element. That said, the rest of the game lacks the atmosphere of the omaha beach level, mainly because throughout the whole game your character fights alone.

What does this have to do with Call of Duty? Well, it so happened that during the development of Medal of Honor Allied Assault, a group of people left the development team and formed Infinite Ward. They got a contract with Activision and made Call of Duty, which would come out in 2003. It is said that the reason that group left is because EA wouldn't let them make a soviet campaign.

Anyway, both games have a very similar feel, but there is one big difference. In call of duty - "no man fights alone". That's the line that was used to advertise the game, but it's 100% true.

There are 3 campaigns: American, British and Soviet. Just like Medal of Honor Allied Assault, many levels replicate existing movies. Like for example, American campaign is very similar to Band of Brothers, while the early levels of the Soviet campaign are from the movie Enemy at the Gates (which is a terrible movie with a few good scenes here and there).

The british campaign is the only one that doesn't follow the "no man fights alone" motto. Mainly because it's about a group of SAS operatives, doing various things behind the enemy lines.

I suggest this game to anyone. Actually, this game will make you realize how little evolution in terms of mechanics we had in FPS genre. Here it is as simple as point and shoot. But that's not why i am suggesting it. I am suggesting it because how well it combines narrative and gameplay.

As for my statement above, for those who i interested. Personally, i think that shooters are generally very fun. That is why people always keep buying them and that's why there is so little evolution. Regenerative health, grenade toss back, knife button, sprint - i wouldn't really call them big evolution steps, mostly they just automate stuff that you can already do. It's always been about point and shoot and it's still is. That doesn't mean that there is nothing wrong about today's shooters, but just saying that the concept still hasn't changed.

ps: this is also one of the first shooters to have iron sights, though there were multiple games in 2003 that had them as well (Delta Force Black Hawk Down, Vietcong 1).

26349958.review:
Flawed but it holds up surprisingly well

[b]Story:[/b]
Kill Nazis pretty much. There are repeated characters and missions where they go over briefings but overall, I couldn’t discern any plot other than kill everyone and follow the objectives. It tries to bring character into the mix by having named characters who sometimes have a line or two but it seems like an afterthought. The story is NOT the reason you play the game.

That being said, there is a lot of effort put into establishing atmosphere. As a russian soldier, you feel like fodder. As an American, you feel the ranks progressing and the desperate struggle to stay alive. It’s not rich on narrative but the setting really pulls you in.

[b]Gameplay:[/b]
It’s COD. You shoot other people. But surprisingly, health bar! Which means that you have to look around for packs and you’re on the edge because you die pretty easily. It keeps the game tense especially when you’re in tight hallways where people could come at you from different angles. The shooting itself feels actually pretty good. It holds up well as you take opportunities to pop out of cover to shoot at a guy at a distance or mow down close soldiers. Both sniping and machine gunning feel good and hell, even the tank section controls and plays well.

That being said, I never threw a grenade or used my pistol throughout the entire game so it might be kinda unbalanced. One big problem area is the AI. You usually have a few people with you except for a few missions where you’re alone. It’s really strange fighting alone because you’re not freaking Rambo. Even if you start the level with comrades, they can die which can leave you alone at the end of the level. It’s really annoying and I wish there was more group charges (like the end level which was awesome). There are short sequences where you have to wait for reinforcements and I found these to be annoying because you can wait for 2 minutes but for fucks sake 5 sodding minutes?

[b]Graphics/Performance: (with a 970, 4790K, 16GB of RAM, SSD)[/b]
I wasn’t expecting to say this but the game looks fine. Old? Yes. But fine? Definitely. You know what you’re shooting at and why. The outdoor environments are especially really nice as they tend to open up a bit more.

[b]Final Thoughts:[/b]
This game really shows a team with a good idea making a not perfect game. There are flaws but the core is really good. It’s tense, it shows diversity in its levels, and it tries to be engaging. I’m surprised I really liked it.

25317117.review:
I might have some nostalgic bias towards this particular installment in the franchise as it was one of the very first PC-games I got my hands on back in 2003. But in comparison to other first-person shooters released around the same time, this title holds up supringly well after all these years.

I feel like many of these early 2000's first-person shooters have not aged particulary well, primairly when it comes down to the core gameplay loop, even if there is of course exceptions. And Call of Duty being one of them. Apart from the obvious graphical age, the game does feel very smooth in its general  gunplay and movement. Although the AI is not the best, it does it's job for the most part.

The levels are rather varied, as it takes place on both the eastern and western front and so are the scenarios, as they include anything from conventional warfare to special forces operations and even an infiltration. The perhaps obligatory "turret-sequences" seems to atleast generally work better then the ones in the newer installements, as there is something more glorious to riding in a "french tin-can" through enemy lines then blowing people up from a plane situated far out of reach for the enemy combatant. And while one should perhaps keep the technical limitations of the time at hand, a decent ammount of the levels are literally just corridors with the occasional boxes as cover, which is not too great.

There is an at the least decent variety of guns on all sides, all the most well-known equipment for each side essentially. Albeit a lack of heavy machineguns, as all parties make use of the MG42 for unknown reasons and handguns only exist for the americans and germans.

As far as the actual campaign goes, it covers the american, brittish and soviet war efforts on different front. The first one being as one might expect, largely being based on an airborne soldier and covers his adventures from D-day and beyond. The second brittish one, seemingly only covers one conventional battle, while the rest consists of more special operations as well as the occasional solo run, which I personally find less entertaining. And last but not least, the Soviet one, while the initial landing at Stalingrad makes for a memorable scene, questions need to be raised regarding it's authenticity, due to some reoccuring unfortunate tendencies when it comes to portraying them alongside the other factions. But after the initial scenes, it too does a a good portrayal of the war and has the most glorious ending.

I have not played the multiplayer since probably about 12 years, so I won't go too deep into what it is about, but to my understanding there are still a few servers with a fairly active community up and running.

In conclusion, I would very much recommend this title if you can handle the aging graphics, although it may still be a bit expensive for being older then a decade, so one might want to wait for a sale in that case.
